ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
Practicing Hindi grammar (kuch/khoi, subjunctive, passive, relative-correlative, etc)
Practicing Hindi conversational skills
Practicing Hindi reading/writing

In this course I developed the ability to have casual conversations, to order food, to shop, and to follow basic instructions in Hindi. I also gained to ability to read and interpret poems and translate news headlines and articles. I learned about northern Indian customs and culture, and I learned about the grammatical structure of the Hindi language.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: reading textbook/doing exercises during class was very helpful, conversation sections were helpful 
Weaknesses: could be more organized on Canvas

The biggest strength of this course was the close involvement of faculty with the learning process. This class met five days a week, and save for the weekly quiz, every day involved new concepts, reading material, and activities. Furthermore, the feedback I received on these assignments was prompt and thorough, and I was able to apply the corrections immediately in my speech and on the weekly quiz. The class was well-rounded in focusing on speaking, listening, reading, and writing skills. My only critique of the course work is that I think we would have benefited from more long-term assignments, such as stories or videos which took multiple days, although I know avoiding this may have been a determination to bolster the engagement of students.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you started at L1 it is required. In that case it is a good culmination of skills and practicing skills learned in previous semesters.

I would absolutely recommend this course to anyone who is interested in learning Hindi or who would simply like to learn a language that will be broadly applicable in their interactions with others. The course was enjoyable and engaging, with a great group atmosphere.
